explanation: The Bush Doctrine was laid down by the US President George W, Bush in 2001. It refers to foreign policy principles of the President of the united states, George W. Bush. Charles Krathammer first used the phrase in June 2001. Generally, the Bush Doctrine was used to indicate a willingness to unilaterally Pursue U. S. military interests. Some of these policies were incorporated in a National Security Council proposals the National Security strategy of the United states, published on September 20, 2002.
